newsitem.title: CHINA: China bans company use of private bank accounts.
newsitem.headline: China bans company use of private bank accounts.

text.p: China's central bank has ordered banks not to allow firms or government departments to move funds into private accounts in order to avoid paying back outstanding loans, a central bank official said on Wednesday.
The official said the People's Bank of China had sent out an urgent circular to stop the practice, which it said was having a serious impact on the country's economy and financial system.
He said that many firms with outstanding debts avoided paying them back by placing cash on hand in private bank accounts, making it hard for the banking authorities to spot funds.
Some government departments also moved funds obtained from fines and various management fees into private accounts to retain them for their own use, he said.
